['Robotics Engineer ', 'Webster, NY 14580 ', 'RAM Photonics, LLC', 'https://indeed.com/pagead/clk?mo=r&ad=-6NYlbfkN0A9Zw7TE4pLn5-rHh7rneNI4keqHaewMZWQsaNiAwBEpE1zZFd3e3rmTRVkRqx2ZuTebmLTDTzh8dKr8vSYYYrP73t9-mZjb5j5rV9kDDnH1vUKvGYGITkylth8tUm2gjCm-Skh_Zb-xKteHYOiha3wiNOaOEQbz9eOy2fQRnu0Vg4_fLCw6ilwHL5HHbH-jk4esAInfkQXMIKC3Wwgsx1bo35b1JqtQQzDItiRA1L9PG257VrjP3ILpffOEE2ridK48tlHedF3uTKwQQvXzh4m3O81dSROjrqLBnHm-OcbZJfTEgjrr9Y7lZBaSZWyRAAL_2314dvnM5-Uq3TpJjZiEEoLhWleAmH28fAGltFEz4Ak9ZYj1jrAHUF_pWq9onGiFUDSxmnQdmJ46RaIlDSGX3bHShRHv0YyTQ7ktzLN1gUOBbHNe0Dw&vjs=3&p=8&sk=&fvj=1', "Company Description RAM Photonics has its headquarters in San Diego CA, with facilities in San Diego CA and Rochester NY. The company portfolio includes specialty optical and optoelectronic systems for defense, commercial, and industrial applications, including advanced signal processing, high-power laser, and instrumentation systems. RAM Photonics seeks capable, creative, and driven contributors skilled at communicating and performing within a technical team composed of leading photonics, electronics, and software engineers. Job Description The Robotics Engineer will be responsible for development of and will contribute to the commercialization of a new class of technology for manufacturing high-power laser systems. The candidate is expected to: contribute to overall system specifications; design and construct precision robotic systems and subsystems for handling and processing optical fiber; and work with suppliers and manufacturers to design for manufacturability and take technology to production. The exact title and level assigned to the position will depend on the candidate's experience and capability. Experience Requirements:  B.S., M.S., or Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering or related field. At least 3 years of experience in robotic system design. Track record of designing and building robotic systems with extensive experience in precision motion and machine vision. Relevant experience in system architecture, including broad technical knowledge in mechanical design, electronic controls, precision motion and positioning, optical fibers, and lasers. Experience in grabbers/grippers (mechanical and vacuum) for handling and handoff of small, sensitive payloads. Experience in machine vision and sub-micron precision positioning and motion. Experience in design, fabrication, and testing of custom electro-mechanical components and sub-systems. Experience in off-the-shelf robotic components and subsystems, including electronics and programming. Experience in schematic capture tools, version control, and CAD tools. Structured modeling and hands-on capabilities in robotic system design and development. Comfortable in the lab assembling mechanical components and electronics, soldering boards as needed. A self-starter and team player with excellent communication skills. Desired Skills:  Familiar with at least one CAD package, preferably Solidworks. Programming control experience in LabVIEW, C++, Python, or similar software. Job Type: Full-time", <html dir="ltr" lang="en">

icl-Grid-col icl-u-xs-span12 icl-u-lg-span7"><div class="jobsearch-JobComponent icl-u-xs-mt--sm"><div class="jobsearch-DesktopStickyContainer"><h3 class="icl-u-xs-mb--xs icl-u-xs-mt--none jobsearch-JobInfoHeader-title">Robotics Engineer</h3><div class="icl-u-xs-mt--xs icl-u-textColor--secondary jobsearch-JobInfoHeader-subtitle jobsearch-DesktopStickyContainer-subtitle"><div class="jobsearch-InlineCompanyRating icl-u-xs-mt--xs jobsearch-DesktopStickyContainer-companyrating"><div class="icl-u-lg-mr--sm icl-u-xs-mr--xs">RAM Photonics, LLC</div><div class="icl-u-lg-mr--sm icl-u-xs-mr--xs">-</div><div>Webster, NY 14580</div></div></div><div class="jobsearch-StickyContainerDivider"><div class="jobsearch-StickyContainerDivider-line"></div></div></div><div class="jobsearch-JobComponent-description icl-u-xs-mt--md"><p><b>Company Description</b></p><p>RAM Photonics has its headquarters in San Diego CA, with facilities in San Diego CA and Rochester NY. The company portfolio includes specialty optical and optoelectronic systems for defense, commercial, and industrial applications, including advanced signal processing, high-power laser, and instrumentation systems. RAM Photonics seeks capable, creative, and driven contributors skilled at communicating and performing within a technical team composed of leading photonics, electronics, and software engineers.</p><p><b>Job Description</b></p><p>The Robotics Engineer will be responsible for development of and will contribute to the commercialization of a new class of technology for manufacturing high-power laser systems. The candidate is expected to: contribute to overall system specifications; design and construct precision robotic systems and subsystems for handling and processing optical fiber; and work with suppliers and manufacturers to design for manufacturability and take technology to production. The exact title and level assigned to the position will depend on the candidate's experience and capability.</p><p><b>Experience Requirements: </b></p><ul><li>B.S., M.S., or Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering or related field.</li><li>At least 3 years of experience in robotic system design.</li><li>Track record of designing and building robotic systems with extensive experience in precision motion and machine vision.</li><li>Relevant experience in system architecture, including broad technical knowledge in mechanical design, electronic controls, precision motion and positioning, optical fibers, and lasers.</li><li>Experience in grabbers/grippers (mechanical and vacuum) for handling and handoff of small, sensitive payloads.</li><li>Experience in machine vision and sub-micron precision positioning and motion.</li><li>Experience in design, fabrication, and testing of custom electro-mechanical components and sub-systems.</li><li>Experience in off-the-shelf robotic components and subsystems, including electronics and programming.</li><li>Experience in schematic capture tools, version control, and CAD tools.</li><li>Structured modeling and hands-on capabilities in robotic system design and development.</li><li>Comfortable in the lab assembling mechanical components and electronics, soldering boards as needed.</li><li>A self-starter and team player with excellent communication skills.</li></ul><p><b>Desired Skills: </b></p><ul><li>Familiar with at least one CAD package, preferably Solidworks.</li><li>Programming control experience in LabVIEW, C++, Python, or similar software.</li></ul><p>Job Type: Full-time</p></div><div class="jobsearch-JobDescriptionTab-content"><div class="jobsearch-JobMetadataFooter">30+ days ago<span class="icl-u-lg-inline icl-u-xs-hide" id="saveJobInlineCallout"> - <a title="Save this job to my.indeed">save job</a></span><span> - <a class="iclcom-ReportJobForm-link" title="Report this job">report job</a></span><div This vision unites us as a team each and every day and is the hallmark of our customer-driven culture. Making the world’s best vehicles can only happen with the world’s greatest employees. GM is in the process of reinventing our industry with innovative products like the Chevy Volt and OnStar. Our 202,000 employees work in 158 facilities touching six continents, they speak more than 50 languages and touch 23 time zones. From designing and engineering state-of-the-art plants and developing new vehicles and technologies to creating new marketing programs, our team members are valued for their unique contributions. We are seeking individuals who are looking to make a difference in one of the world’s most iconic companies. \n \n \n General Motors has built a reputation of excellence across all brands that we build putting the customers at the center of what we do. We understand that being the industry leader in the auto manufacturing and automotive technology comes with big responsibilities. That’s why at GM we are  Made for More!  At GM Global Propulsion Systems we ranked #1 for automotive companies in number of US patents by the Wall Street Journal- 2014. As a member of our Global Propulsion Systems team you will be supporting the continuous success of 7 castings, 16 transmission and 31 engine sites globally. You will be working with a world class team that ranks amongst one of the world’s largest automotive suppliers.\n \n MISSION: \n \nOur mission at GM Global Propulsion Systems is to be the bridge between Manufacturing and Powertrain Engineering throughout the Global Powertrain Development process. Global Propulsion designs, develops, procures and implements efficient manufacturing systems, through standardize processes, to deliver world class propulsion systems, while keeping safety as our over – riding priority. \n \nThe "career" level process engineer responsible for developing and supporting manufacturing processes utilizing robots. Equipment/tooling alternatives, sequence and flow of operations for the effective utilization of personnel, material, machines and facilities necessary for the production of parts. Work is performed in a centralized manufacturing engineering activity or assembly/plant activity where a considerable amount of creativity and initiative is exercised as well as a high level of independent judgment. \n \nRESPONSIBILITIES: \n \nAssist in the procurement and evaluation of the application of robots in manufacturing processes \nMaintain working contacts with lead process and controls engineering teams, vendors, GM IT, other internal engineering disciplines and management at plant and headquarters \nDiagnose and correct deficiencies in robot centric manufacturing processes \nStay abreast of new robot technology, computer graphics, and robot engineering tools \nHave working knowledge of controls interfaces to robots \nAssist in the deployment of new technology to minimize risks \nPropose and evaluate robotic manufacturing processes and equipment \nPerform simultaneous engineering activities with ME and equipment supplier representatives \nParticipate in safety g-Risk activities with cross functional group \nApprove robot documentation and support robotic run-offs at OEM site \nSolve / assist operational problems as required \nSupport & actively interact with manufacturing operations group \nSupport deployment of best common systems and methods as defined in the PT Global Controls Bill of Process \nContinuously improve quality, cost, responsiveness & safety \nBASIC REQUIRED: \nGood technical knowledge and ability in process engineering disciplines \nGod knowledge and ability to implement robotic technology in various manufacturing systems \nExperience with Fanuc Robots \nDemonstrated level of analytical ability, communication and interpersonal skills required to build relationships with team members and customers to solve problems and resolve issues. \nDemonstrated ability to manage multiple and difficult projects and assignments with high level of autonomy and Accountability for results \nDemonstrated initiative by reaching beyond work assigned to improve output and/or help others \nProven ability in project management skills \nExperience with GM Global Robot Standards (GRS)\n Experience with Global Common Controll architecture (GCCH, GCCS, etc.) \nBASIC PREFERRED: \nMaster’s Degree preferred\n Experience with various robot manufacturers\n  EDUCATION: \nBachelor’s degree or equivalent experience', <html dir="ltr" lang="en">

class="jobsearch-CompanyReview icl-u-lg-hide"><a class="icl-NavigableContainer-linkWrapper" href="https://www.indeed.com/cmp/General-Motors/reviews?campaignid=mobvjcmp&amp;cmpratingc=mobviewjob&amp;from=mobviewjob&amp;tk=1coeouccga2cv800&amp;fromjk=8804a7c947e7a199&amp;jt=Process+Engineer+-+Robotics+Engineer"><div class="icl-NavigableContainer icl-NavigableContainer--hasBorderBottom icl-NavigableContainer--hasBorderTop"><div class="icl-NavigableContainer-innerContainer"><h4 class="jobsearch-CompanyReview--heading">General Motors</h4><div class="icl-Ratings icl-Ratings--gold icl-Ratings--md" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/AggregateRating"><meta content="4.199999809265137" itemprop="ratingValue"><meta content="6138" itemprop="ratingCount"><div aria-label="4.2 out of 5" class="icl-Ratings-starsCountWrapper" tabindex="0"><div class="icl-Ratings-starsWrapper"><div class="icl-Ratings-starsUnfilled"><div class="icl-Ratings-starsFilled" style="width: 77.39999771118164px;"></div></div></div><div aria-hidden="true" class="icl-NavigableContainer-iconContainer"><div class="icl-NavigableContainer-icon icl-NavigableContainer-icon--isRightArrow"><svg class="icl-Icon icl-Icon--sm icl-Icon--left icl-Icon--black icl-u-xs-mt--md"><div><div><b>OVERVIEW:</b></div><br/>
<div>
At the new General Motors, we are passionate about designing, building and selling the world’s best vehicles. This vision unites us as a team each and every day and is the hallmark of our customer-driven culture. Making the world’s best vehicles can only happen with the world’s greatest employees. GM is in the process of reinventing our industry with innovative products like the Chevy Volt and OnStar. Our 202,000 employees work in 158 facilities touching six continents, they speak more than 50 languages and touch 23 time zones. From designing and engineering state-of-the-art plants and developing new vehicles and technologies to creating new marketing programs, our team members are valued for their unique contributions. We are seeking individuals who are looking to make a difference in one of the world’s most iconic companies.<br/>
</div><br/>
<br/>
<div>General Motors has built a reputation of excellence across all brands that we build putting the customers at the center of what we do. We understand that being the industry leader in the auto manufacturing and automotive technology comes with big responsibilities. That’s why at GM we are <b>Made for More! </b>At GM Global Propulsion Systems we ranked #1 for automotive companies in number of US patents by the Wall Street Journal- 2014. As a member of our Global Propulsion Systems team you will be supporting the continuous success of 7 castings, 16 transmission and 31 engine sites globally. You will be working with a world class team that ranks amongst one of the world’s largest automotive suppliers.
</div><br/>
<div><b>MISSION:</b></div><br/>
<div>
Our mission at GM Global Propulsion Systems is to be the bridge between Manufacturing and Powertrain Engineering throughout the Global Powertrain Development process. Global Propulsion designs, develops, procures and implements efficient manufacturing systems, through standardize processes, to deliver world class propulsion systems, while keeping safety as our over – riding priority.</div><br/>
<div>
The "career" level process engineer responsible for developing and supporting manufacturing processes utilizing robots. Equipment/tooling alternatives, sequence and flow of operations for the effective utilization of personnel, material, machines and facilities necessary for the production of parts. Work is performed in a centralized manufacturing engineering activity or assembly/plant activity where a considerable amount of creativity and initiative is exercised as well as a high level of independent judgment.</div><br/>
<div><b>
RESPONSIBILITIES:</b></div><br/>
<ul><li>
Assist in the procurement and evaluation of the application of robots in manufacturing processes</li><li>
Maintain working contacts with lead process and controls engineering teams, vendors, GM IT, other internal engineering disciplines and management at plant and headquarters</li><li>
Diagnose and correct deficiencies in robot centric manufacturing processes</li><li>
Stay abreast of new robot technology, computer graphics, and robot engineering tools</li><li>
Have working knowledge of controls interfaces to robots</li><li>
Assist in the deployment of new technology to minimize risks</li><li>
Propose and evaluate robotic manufacturing processes and equipment</li><li>
Perform simultaneous engineering activities with ME and equipment supplier representatives</li><li>
Participate in safety g-Risk activities with cross functional group</li><li>
Approve robot documentation and support robotic run-offs at OEM site</li><li>
Solve / assist operational problems as required</li><li>
Support &amp; actively interact with manufacturing operations group</li><li>
Support deployment of best common systems and methods as defined in the PT Global Controls Bill of Process</li><li>
Continuously improve quality, cost, responsiveness &amp; safety</li></ul><div><div><b>
BASIC REQUIRED:</b></div><ul><li>
Good technical knowledge and ability in process engineering disciplines</li><li>
God knowledge and ability to implement robotic technology in various manufacturing systems</li><li>
Experience with Fanuc Robots</li><li>
Demonstrated level of analytical ability, communication and interpersonal skills required to build relationships with team members and customers to solve problems and resolve issues.</li><li>
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple and difficult projects and assignments with high level of autonomy and Accountability for results</li><li>
Demonstrated initiative by reaching beyond work assigned to improve output and/or help others</li><li>
Proven ability in project management skills</li><li><div>
Experience with GM Global Robot Standards (GRS)
</div><div>Experience with Global Common Controll architecture (GCCH, GCCS, etc.)</div></li></ul><div><b>
BASIC PREFERRED:</b></div><ul><li>
Master’s Degree preferred
</li><li>Experience with various robot manufacturers
 </li></ul><div><b>EDUCATION:</b></div><ul><li>
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience</li></ul></div></div></div><div class="jobsearch-JobDescriptionTab-content"><div class="jobsearch-JobMetadataFooter"><span ['Principle Software Engineer - Robotics ', 'Carson, CA ', 'Epson America, Inc', 'https://indeed.com/pagead/clk?mo=r&ad=-6NYlbfkN0Dzv71fE5aHzPayVX6R-gU-7RKwHw63-pV_sW38T11Z5k5xYfClxj-0R-bAmyij9iqC6aNz9R1RWq21nHg_DXEGSaTxw1RHVaNKYc9tkBVfzhYMBlb0vb7C0sXIG_-OsPSrZkVaIrw4BFqbxC1KmQwyNU-9vDgvncLERUC-BSVA2mgcCqmokKm3yynxmycqfjHY6_nopqF7r2eTMNYM8ls4HsclFm1yNub1jEVATcHBcPtlANNjwv42O474s-z9Pr5gzbqzs76w71wSR4H6VQbcICOIi9uIsSkriBPWZQ5sBZNckAKic3HY6soBsoWpPHR_si3ZiFxGfOQu3JCTZ3vCufUgVhjU_x5JbWCkC8HMGigDxD7yqQR3LIrTG2yrTdRBBqDSGYhcKr94jU7LpO76oS-kQ8Biok-StiJebR-z0CQ7Bqst3rshK2NvMthfgrAsXi16yuhqJm543YboW3t3GuD7zPd0YPQSlXlRjESFH3HpV977nw4DozHz6l9BaT6T1mNGo8U_CnE9R6cIHJrF&vjs=3&p=6&sk=&fvj=0', 'As part of Factory Automation Robotics team, the Principal Software Engineer will be responsible for developing high-volume worldwide customer-facing software. \n Why work at Epson?\n Epson enables people worldwide to make, share and capture creativity and bring it to life. Epson technologies open the door to limitless opportunities in visual communications, robotics, sensing, and business and commercial digital imaging. As a global innovator Epson applies its cutting-edge technologies in markets including sports, fashion, augmented reality, and personal healthcare. \n We also offer: Competitive salaries, excellent benefits (medical, matching 401k, retirement plan, holidays, vacation etc.), team environment, strong executive leadership and an enjoyable work environment with great people to work with! \n \n What you will be responsible for: \n Collaborating with Epson’s parent company in Engineering for the identification, definition, and review of software requirements for existing or new Factory Automation Robotics products \n Designing and developing the software and supporting documentation to meet customer requirements, providing advanced technical support for Factory Automation Robotics products, and maintaining and troubleshooting Factory Automation Robotics local area network and server \n Also responsible for leading/driving activities of the Epson America’s software development team \n What you will be doing: \n Software Design \n Leads Epson America’s software development team through coordinating development direction, activities and schedules \n Participates in gathering user/customer requirements for software from internal sources \n Collaborates with Epson’s parent company in the definition and review of software requirements \n Participates with Epson’s parent company in development of project plans (e.g., time estimates, specifications) \n Develops software programs for new products within project timelines \n Develops supporting technical documentation for products \n Leads quality assurance activities to ensure that quality standards for products are met \n Assists Epson’s parent company designers in solving complex technical problems \n Technical Support \n Interfaces with technical support teams to resolve advanced customer technical issues; escalates issues that cannot be resolved to management \n Serves as a technical subject matter expert for Factory Automation Robotics products \n Responsible for maintaining and troubleshooting Factory Automation Robotics local area network \n Relationship Management \n Builds strong relationships with peers, other departments, and managers to best meet company goals and objectives \n About your experience: \n Minimum 12+ years of experience in customer facing software \n Experience developing products with: C#, C++, Microsoft windows and Linux \n Robotics experience is a plus \n Experience with graphical user interfaces \n Completion of an undergraduate degree or equivalent experience \n \n \n Epson America, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action Employer \n All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability and protected veteran status, as well as any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.', <html dir="ltr" lang="en">

class="jobsearch-StickyContainerDivider"><div class="jobsearch-StickyContainerDivider-line"></div></div></div><div class="jobsearch-CompanyReview icl-u-lg-hide"><a class="icl-NavigableContainer-linkWrapper" class="icl-NavigableContainer icl-NavigableContainer--hasBorderBottom icl-NavigableContainer--hasBorderTop"><div class="icl-NavigableContainer-innerContainer"><h4 class="jobsearch-CompanyReview--heading">Epson America, Inc</h4><div class="icl-Ratings icl-Ratings--gold icl-Ratings--md" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/AggregateRating"><meta content="3.9000000953674316" itemprop="ratingValue"><meta content="68" itemprop="ratingCount"><div aria-label="3.9 out of 5" class="icl-Ratings-starsCountWrapper" tabindex="0"><div class="icl-Ratings-starsWrapper"><div class="icl-Ratings-starsUnfilled"><div class="icl-Ratings-starsFilled" style="width: 67.80000114440918px;"></div></div></div><div aria-hidden="true" class="icl-NavigableContainer-iconContainer"><div class="icl-NavigableContainer-icon icl-NavigableContainer-icon--isRightArrow"><svg class="icl-Icon icl-Icon--sm icl-Icon--left icl-Icon--black chevron-right" role="img"><g><path d="M7.5,4.5L6.44,5.56,9.88,9,6.44,12.44,7.5,13.5,12,9Z"></path></g></svg></div></div></div></div></a></div><div class="jobsearch-JobComponent-description icl-u-xs-mt--md"><div><div><p>As part of Factory Automation Robotics team, the Principal Software Engineer will be responsible for developing high-volume worldwide customer-facing software.</p>
<p><b>Why work at Epson?
</b></p><p>Epson enables people worldwide to make, share and capture creativity and bring it to life. Epson technologies open the door to limitless opportunities in visual communications, robotics, sensing, and business and commercial digital imaging. As a global innovator Epson applies its cutting-edge technologies in markets including sports, fashion, augmented reality, and personal healthcare.</p>
<p>We also offer: Competitive salaries, excellent benefits (medical, matching 401k, retirement plan, holidays, vacation etc.), team environment, strong executive leadership and an enjoyable work environment with great people to work with!<br/>
<br/>
<b>What you will be responsible for:</b></p>
<ul><li>Collaborating with Epson’s parent company in Engineering for the identification, definition, and review of software requirements for existing or new Factory Automation Robotics products</li>
<li>Designing and developing the software and supporting documentation to meet customer requirements, providing advanced technical support for Factory Automation Robotics products, and maintaining and troubleshooting Factory Automation Robotics local area network and server</li>
<li>Also responsible for leading/driving activities of the Epson America’s software development team</li>
</ul><p><b>What you will be doing:</b></p>
<p><b>Software Design</b></p>
<ul><li>Leads Epson America’s software development team through coordinating development direction, activities and schedules</li>
<li>Participates in gathering user/customer requirements for software from internal sources</li>
<li>Collaborates with Epson’s parent company in the definition and review of software requirements</li>
<li>Participates with Epson’s parent company in development of project plans (e.g., time estimates, specifications)</li>
<li>Develops software programs for new products within project timelines</li>
<li>Develops supporting technical documentation for products</li>
<li>Leads quality assurance activities to ensure that quality standards for products are met</li>
<li>Assists Epson’s parent company designers in solving complex technical problems</li>
</ul><p><b>Technical Support</b></p>
<ul><li>Interfaces with technical support teams to resolve advanced customer technical issues; escalates issues that cannot be resolved to management</li>
<li>Serves as a technical subject matter expert for Factory Automation Robotics products</li>
<li>Responsible for maintaining and troubleshooting Factory Automation Robotics local area network</li>
</ul><p><b>Relationship Management</b></p>
<ul><li>Builds strong relationships with peers, other departments, and managers to best meet company goals and objectives</li>
</ul><p><b>About your experience:</b></p>
<ul><li>Minimum 12+ years of experience in customer facing software</li>
<li>Experience developing products with: C#, C++, Microsoft windows and Linux</li>
<li>Robotics experience is a plus</li>
<li>Experience with graphical user interfaces</li>
<li>Completion of an undergraduate degree or equivalent experience</li>
</ul><br/>
<br/>
</div><p><b>Epson America, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action Employer</b></p>
<p>All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability and protected veteran status, as well as any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.</p></div></div><div class="jobsearch-JobDescriptionTab-content"><div class="jobsearch-JobMetadataFooter"><span Walt Disney Imagineering has a long history of bringing characters to life in the form of Audio-Animatronics.\n \nAt Walt Disney Imagineering, we are continuing to advance the state-of-the-art in advanced, lifelike robotics. As a part of this team, you will help develop the future of our robotics systems and will help us achieve our vision to bring characters to life in unparalleled ways in our parks. BS in Electrical Engineering or an engineering discipline Experience using, specifying and designing with brushless motor drives Experience with Python or MATLAB Ability to write, debug and/or review C and C++ software/firmware Experience with communication busses, their protocols, and interface hardware/software/firmware Experience using schematic capture and PCB layout software Design with sensors, encoders, as well as SPI, I2C, CAN and EtherCAT devices Electronic system architecture development and implementation Good analog, power, and digital circuit design and analysis fundamentals Experience independently designing, specifying, integrating, and testing electronics that interfaces with electro-mechanical hardware Hands-on experience testing and debugging hardware, working with test equipment, soldering, etc. Familiarity with grounding, shielding and noise management in distributed systems Perform full spectrum of electronic and electrical project activities for robotics, including low level and system level design and testing of systems with power, communications, and motor control Deepen your knowledge of complex integrated robotic systems and their components Work independently and in highly diverse and multidisciplinary project teams, and with external partners Develop, test, verify, debug, and refine compact electrical systems via rapid experimental iterations Experience with leadership and the ability to drive progress and decision-making with team members.\n \n502011', <html dir="ltr" lang="en">

class="icl-NavigableContainer-iconContainer"><div class="icl-NavigableContainer-icon icl-NavigableContainer-icon--isRightArrow"><svg class="icl-Icon icl-Icon--sm icl-Icon--left icl-Icon--black icl-u-xs-mt--md">“We create happiness.” That’s our motto at Walt Disney Parks and Resorts. And it permeates everything we do. At Disney, you’ll help inspire that magic by enabling our teams to push the limits of entertainment and create the never-before-seen! Walt Disney Imagineering has a long history of bringing characters to life in the form of Audio-Animatronics.
<br/><br/>
At Walt Disney Imagineering, we are continuing to advance the state-of-the-art in advanced, lifelike robotics. As a part of this team, you will help develop the future of our robotics systems and will help us achieve our vision to bring characters to life in unparalleled ways in our parks. BS in Electrical Engineering or an engineering discipline Experience using, specifying and designing with brushless motor drives Experience with Python or MATLAB Ability to write, debug and/or review C and C++ software/firmware Experience with communication busses, their protocols, and interface hardware/software/firmware Experience using schematic capture and PCB layout software Design with sensors, encoders, as well as SPI, I2C, CAN and EtherCAT devices Electronic system architecture development and implementation Good analog, power, and digital circuit design and analysis fundamentals Experience independently designing, specifying, integrating, and testing electronics that interfaces with electro-mechanical hardware Hands-on experience testing and debugging hardware, working with test equipment, soldering, etc. Familiarity with grounding, shielding and noise management in distributed systems Perform full spectrum of electronic and electrical project activities for robotics, including low level and system level design and testing of systems with power, communications, and motor control Deepen your knowledge of complex integrated robotic systems and their components Work independently and in highly diverse and multidisciplinary project teams, and with external partners Develop, test, verify, debug, and refine compact electrical systems via rapid experimental iterations Experience with leadership and the ability to drive progress and decision-making with team members.
<br/><br/>

Serve as the liaison for the robotics teams at ‘Iolani. These currently include FRC (9-12th grade), FTC (7-8th) and lower school robotics club. Responsibilities include: Being the official point-of-contact for external organizations, volunteer mentors and parents Managing event registration, rosters, team travel and team financial accounts Schedule and coordinate meets and competitions Developing competitive practices in all non-engineering aspects of the competition which impact overall team success (chairman’s award, team video, web site, outreach, etc.) Publicize and raise awareness of ‘Iolani robotics both within the school and in the community. This includes encouraging community outreach, demonstrations, etc. Manage a web site and ensure that it is updated regularly with team activities. Maintain fabrication spaces, tools & equipment. Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: ** Enthusiasm for STEAM education and working with students of various age groups. Technical experience, such as engineering, programming, or industrial arts preferred Exhibit outstanding organization and time management skills Display highly effective communication skills geared to various age groups Able to work well collaboratively and independently Education and Experience: ** Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Arts, Industrial Design or related field required. 2+ years professional educational experience working with secondary school-age children preferred. Experience with the FIRST or other robotics related programs preferred. Demonstrable hands on design and fabrication experience. 2+ years experience with embedded design (arduino, raspberry pi etc). 2+ years experience with 3D modelling using Onshape, SolidWorks or similar. Salary: ** Contingent upon work experience. Must Apply at: https://www.iolani.org/employment Job Type: Full-time Experience: engineering, programming or industrial arts: 2 years (Required) working with secondary school-age children: 2 years (Preferred) Education: Bachelor's (Required)", <html dir="ltr" lang="en">

class="jobsearch-StickyContainerDivider-line"></div></div></div><div class="jobsearch-JobComponent-description icl-u-xs-mt--md"><p><i>Seeking an after school Robotics Coach and iDept Faculty member for a growing and innovative </i><i>Robotics program at </i><i>‘_</i>Iolani School._</p><p>Essential Duties and Responsibilities: **</p><ul><li>Faculty member in iDept, teaching STEAM, Robotics or Innovation courses in grades 7-12th.</li><li>Serve as the liaison for the robotics teams at ‘Iolani. These currently include FRC (9-12th grade), FTC (7-8th) and lower school robotics club. Responsibilities include:</li><li>Being the official point-of-contact for external organizations, volunteer mentors and parents</li><li>Managing event registration, rosters, team travel and team financial accounts</li><li>Schedule and coordinate meets and competitions</li><li>Developing competitive practices in all non-engineering aspects of the competition which impact overall team success (chairman’s award, team video, web site, outreach, etc.)</li><li>Publicize and raise awareness of ‘Iolani robotics both within the school and in the community. This includes encouraging community outreach, demonstrations, etc.</li><li>Manage a web site and ensure that it is updated regularly with team activities.</li><li>Maintain fabrication spaces, tools &amp; equipment.</li></ul><p>Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: **</p><ul><li>Enthusiasm for STEAM education and working with students of various age groups.</li><li>Technical experience, such as engineering, programming, or industrial arts preferred</li><li>Exhibit outstanding organization and time management skills</li><li>Display highly effective communication skills geared to various age groups</li><li>Able to work well collaboratively and independently</li></ul><p>Education and Experience: **</p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Arts, Industrial Design or related field required.</li><li>2+ years professional educational experience working with secondary school-age children preferred.</li><li>Experience with the FIRST or other robotics related programs preferred.</li><li>Demonstrable hands on design and fabrication experience.</li><li>2+ years experience with embedded design (arduino, raspberry pi etc).</li><li>2+ years experience with 3D modelling using Onshape, SolidWorks or similar.</li></ul><p>Salary: **</p><p>Contingent upon work experience.</p><p><b>Must Apply at: https://www.iolani.org/employment</b></p><p>Job Type: Full-time</p><p>Experience:</p><ul><li>engineering, programming or industrial arts: 2 years (Required)</li><li>working with secondary school-age children: 2 years (Preferred)</li></ul><p>Education:</p><ul><li>Bachelor's (Required)</li></ul></div><div class="jobsearch-JobDescriptionTab-content"><div class="jobsearch-JobMetadataFooter">30+ days ago<span We focus on developing innovative solutions to our customer's needs that are both technically sound and cost effective. Innovative ideas and talented individuals are the foundation on which LSA Autonomy was formed. Our staff possesses a great deal of experience with robotic and autonomous systems. As our customer base expands, we are seeking to hire highly motivated and highly competent Software Engineers at our Westminster, MD office. Development opportunities include real-time embedded controls, sensor processing, and high-level autonomy algorithms. A typical project includes software development and testing, software/hardware integration and testing, and possibly field support of the delivered product. Job Functions Engineering - Electrical Engineering / Software Desired Skills Minimum Qualifications: Very proficient in C++ and object oriented design Experienced in network communication Experienced in software troubleshooting and debugging Initiative and ability to work independently and as part of a team Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related engineering field Ability to obtain government security clearance Preferred Qualifications: Ability to develop new algorithms Comfortable performing hardware troubleshooting Proficient in requirements analysis Ability to work well with others and under deadlines Key Responsibilities: Collaborate with team members to develop, integrate, and test new features on our unmanned platforms Propose new capabilities and implement those ideas Maintain and refactor existing code bases Promote great software design and code quality Work Authorization Requirements US work authorization is required Job Type: Full-time Education: Bachelor's (Required) License: Ability to obtain US Government security clearance (Required)", <html dir="ltr" lang="en">

class="jobsearch-InlineCompanyRating icl-u-xs-mt--xs jobsearch-DesktopStickyContainer-companyrating"><div class="icl-u-lg-mr--sm icl-u-xs-mr--xs">LSA Autonomy</div><div class="icl-u-lg-mr--sm class="jobsearch-JobComponent-description icl-u-xs-mt--md"><p>Land Sea Air Autonomy is dedicated to providing affordable autonomous solutions. We focus on developing innovative solutions to our customer's needs that are both technically sound and cost effective.</p><p>Innovative ideas and talented individuals are the foundation on which LSA Autonomy was formed. Our staff possesses a great deal of experience with robotic and autonomous systems. As our customer base expands, we are seeking to hire highly motivated and highly competent Software Engineers at our Westminster, MD office.</p><p>Development opportunities include real-time embedded controls, sensor processing, and high-level autonomy algorithms. A typical project includes software development and testing, software/hardware integration and testing, and possibly field support of the delivered product.</p><p>Job Functions<br/>Engineering - Electrical Engineering / Software</p><p>Desired Skills<br/>Minimum Qualifications:</p><ul><li>Very proficient in C++ and object oriented design</li><li>Experienced in network communication</li><li>Experienced in software troubleshooting and debugging</li><li>Initiative and ability to work independently and as part of a team</li><li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related engineering field</li><li>Ability to obtain government security clearance</li></ul><p>Preferred Qualifications:</p><ul><li>Ability to develop new algorithms</li><li>Comfortable performing hardware troubleshooting</li><li>Proficient in requirements analysis</li><li>Ability to work well with others and under deadlines</li></ul><p>Key Responsibilities:</p><ul><li>Collaborate with team members to develop, integrate, and test new features on our unmanned platforms</li><li>Propose new capabilities and implement those ideas</li><li>Maintain and refactor existing code bases</li><li>Promote great software design and code quality</li></ul><p>Work Authorization Requirements<br/>US work authorization is required</p><p>Job Type: Full-time</p><p>Education:</p><ul><li>Bachelor's (Required)</li></ul><p>License:</p><ul><li>Ability to obtain US Government security clearance (Required)</li></ul></div><div ['Robotics CNC Machine Engineer ', 'Schaumburg, IL 60173 ', 'Yamazen, Inc', 'https://indeed.com/pagead/clk?mo=r&ad=-6NYlbfkN0BPIJ68mJTjJSNsYid0b1fWApXU33ypYHlwLg5R8T1GHCQuvFCYVAiPTzud0Szs7zp__LaqOGAMJAx7mp7b0LlSCqgdiP8FW0abcw1nrGDZmFoLitzfzXibsKGy6AMeugAo27qAeGOUfvmbL_c5ANnCNrNzCXyZX6BHIVmIanlXgxiqhG7LLQV2tjodIbmlDmJ_NzyMlxORqer6qzoPRN_ki2eMW16vgVz3yanszLBmp0qJylVwe_Y3XhB6Kpy10rVAt7d1ELwWHDHH9TnB964K62gtXrXAw4FLt9_mc-2ag59z5a5aytSTHsKiLitzYk-qM1-2pPL8yIH0KIKxA5nRmPpMdeD2Cqzg6kHawTJjP4QCgyxBWIoZkkW7D5dfH-DhET5n2QjKtKXf8tGG8fx3O5YmFhIg9uM_tfvlqTnK_OtTpk99u_ZwsObyW13GjOA=&vjs=3&p=2&sk=&fvj=1', "Company Profile:  Yamazen Inc. is an importer and distributor of quality CNC manufacturing machinery, including machine tools and injection molding machines. We service manufacturers in the automotive, aerospace, construction equipment, medical, and I.T. industries. We have 13 U.S. offices serving markets throughout the country and have experienced significant growth through territory and market expansion. We are building a new automation group to better serve our customers. Opportunity:  Yamazen has an immediate opening for a  Robotics CNC   (Automation) Engineer  to join our team. As an automation engineer you will be responsible for robot programming, project management, CAD drawings and renderings of proposed cells. The chosen candidate with will enjoy working from a state-of-the-art technical facility in  Schaumburg, IL . Our main focus will to automate our CNC Brother and/or CNC Takisawa lathes. Additional responsibilities include assisting with the redesign of our automation machine tending cell called our Flex loader and setting up suppliers. Skills and Qualifications:  The preferred candidate will possess a strong machining background that includes: 3 years of experience in CNC machine tending automation, both in turning and milling 3 years of robot programing experience, including robotic end of arm tooling design Project Management experience Solid organization and prioritization skills A strong work ethic and problem-solving skills The ability to work under pressure with strict deadlines Strong verbal and written skills A valid driver’s license and reliable transportation is required Compensation and Benefits:  In return for quality results, Yamazen Inc. provides a competitive compensation package including salary and semi-annual bonus opportunities. Employee benefits include  company paid  medical, dental, vision, short- & long-term disability and life insurance within the first 90 days, 401K with company match, holiday shut-down between Christmas and New Year’s Day, and more! No phone calls please. Yamazen is an equal opportunity employment company. All applicants are considered regardless of age, race, sex, color, national origin, religion, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation or any other protected status. Job Type: Full-time Salary: $70,000.00 to $90,000.00 /year Experience: automation programming: 3 years (Required) License: Driver's License (Required) Work authorization: United States (Required)", <html dir="ltr" lang="en">

class="jobsearch-CompanyReview--heading">Yamazen, Inc</h4><div class="icl-Ratings icl-Ratings--gold icl-Ratings--md" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/AggregateRating"><meta content="3.0" d="M7.5,4.5L6.44,5.56,9.88,9,6.44,12.44,7.5,13.5,12,9Z"></path></g></svg></div></div></div></div></a></div><div class="jobsearch-JobComponent-description icl-u-xs-mt--md"><p><b>Company Profile: </b></p><p>Yamazen Inc. is an importer and distributor of quality CNC manufacturing machinery, including machine tools and injection molding machines. We service manufacturers in the automotive, aerospace, construction equipment, medical, and I.T. industries. We have 13 U.S. offices serving markets throughout the country and have experienced significant growth through territory and market expansion. We are building a new automation group to better serve our customers.</p><p><b>Opportunity: </b></p><p>Yamazen has an immediate opening for a <b>Robotics CNC</b> <b>(Automation) Engineer</b> to join our team. As an automation engineer you will be responsible for robot programming, project management, CAD drawings and renderings of proposed cells. The chosen candidate with will enjoy working from a state-of-the-art technical facility in <b>Schaumburg, IL</b>. Our main focus will to automate our CNC Brother and/or CNC Takisawa lathes. Additional responsibilities include assisting with the redesign of our automation machine tending cell called our Flex loader and setting up suppliers.</p><p><b>Skills and Qualifications: </b></p><p>The preferred candidate will possess a strong machining background that includes:</p><ul><li>3 years of experience in CNC machine tending automation, both in turning and milling</li><li>3 years of robot programing experience, including robotic end of arm tooling design</li><li>Project Management experience</li><li>Solid organization and prioritization skills</li><li>A strong work ethic and problem-solving skills</li><li>The ability to work under pressure with strict deadlines</li><li>Strong verbal and written skills</li><li>A valid driver’s license and reliable transportation is required</li></ul><p><b>Compensation and Benefits: </b></p><p>In return for quality results, Yamazen Inc. provides a competitive compensation package including salary and semi-annual bonus opportunities. Employee benefits include <b>company paid</b> medical, dental, vision, short- &amp; long-term disability and life insurance within the first 90 days, 401K with company match, holiday shut-down between Christmas and New Year’s Day, and more!</p><p>No phone calls please.</p><p><i>Yamazen is an equal opportunity employment company. All applicants are considered regardless of age, race, sex, color, national origin, religion, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation or any other protected status.</i></p><p>Job Type: Full-time</p><p>Salary: $70,000.00 to $90,000.00 /year</p><p>Experience:</p><ul><li>automation programming: 3 years (Required)</li></ul><p>License:</p><ul><li>Driver's License We have a competitive advantage with our products, and strive for our vision products to integrate seamlessly with robots from all the major industrial robot manufacturers. We are seeking Robotics Engineers/programmers with 3 to 5 years minimum experience to support our V-Guide product. Ideal candidates possess the following qualifications: Experience with machine vision, sensors, PC software programming, and/or PLCs, but you do not have to have expertise in any of these. Candidates must be willing to travel, are self starters, and possess good communication skills.
